title: Kirchhoff junction - relate I1 I2 I3 to I-battery

content.question: The figure shows a circuit composed of a battery and three identical resistors. Which of the following correctly relates the currents <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="I sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> in the resistors to the current <math alttext="I sub battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>battery</mi></msub></math> in the battery, and provides reasoning that supports the stated relation?

choices.label: <math alttext="I sub 1, end sub, plus I sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 3, end sub, equals I sub battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>battery</mtext></msub></math>. The total amount of charge entering and exiting a junction per unit time must be equal.

<math alttext="I sub 1, end sub, plus I sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 3, end sub, equals I sub battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>battery</mtext></msub></math>. The potential differences across the three resistor branches sum to the potential difference of the battery, and potential difference is proportional to current.

<math alttext="I sub 1, end sub, equals I sub 2, end sub, which equals I sub 3, end sub, which equals I sub battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>battery</mtext></msub></math>. Parallel circuit branches must all have the same current.

<math alttext="I sub 1, end sub, equals I sub 2, end sub, which equals I sub 3, end sub, which equals I sub battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>battery</mtext></msub></math>. Current is directly proportional to potential difference, and the potential difference is the same across each parallel branch of the circuit.

content.answer: <math alttext="I sub 1, end sub, plus I sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 3, end sub, equals I sub battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>battery</mtext></msub></math>. The total amount of charge entering and exiting a junction per unit time must be equal.
